gurmukhi: bwgVdMg bwjy nwgVdMg ngwry ] jwgVdMg joDw mwgVdMg mwry ] fwgVdMg if`gy KwgVdMg KUnI ] cwgVdMg caupy dwgVdMg dUnI ]442]
transliteration: Baagaddaddan Baaje Naagaddaddan Nagdare|| Jaagaddaddan Jodhaa Maagaddaddan Mdare|| Daagaddaddan Digge Khadganndaddan Khnnee|| Chaagaddaddan Chaoupe Daagaddaddan Doonee||442||
translation: The trumpets sounded and the warriors were killed; the bloody fighters fell and their zeal doubled.442.

gurmukhi: hwgVdMg ih`sy swgVdMg is`DM ] BwgVdMg Bwjy bwgVdMg biR`DM ] CwgVdMg Cu`ty qwgVdMg qIrM ] jwgVdMg ju`ty bwgVdMg bIrM ]443]
transliteration: Haagaddaddan Hisse Saagaddaddan Siddhan|| Bhaagaddaddan Bhaaje Baagaddaddan Briddhan|| Chhaadaddaddan Chhoutte Taagaddaddan Tderan|| Jaagaddaddan Joutte Baagaddaddan Bderan||443||
translation: The adepts laughed and the groups of warriors ran away; the arrows were discharged and the warriors fought among themselves.443.

gurmukhi: kwgVdMg kuhky bwgVdMg bwxM ] PwgVdMg Prky nwgVdMg inSwxM ] bwgVdMg bwjI BwgVdMg ByrI ] swgVdMg sYxM PwgVdMg PyrI ]444]
transliteration: Kaagaddaddan Kuhke Baagaddaddan Baanan|| Phaagaddaddan Pharke Naagaddaddan Nishaanan|| Baagaddaddan Baajibhaagaddaddan Bhdare|| Saagaddaddan Sainan Phaagaddaddan Pderee||444||
translation: There was the sound of arrows and the trumpets sounded; the kettledrums were played and the armies roamed.444.

gurmukhi: BwgVdMg BIrM kwgVdMg kMpY ] mwgVdMg mwry jwgVdMg jMpY ] CwgVdMg CpRM BwgVdMg Bwjy ] cwgVdMg ic`qM lwgVdMg lwjy ]445]
transliteration: Bhaagaddan Bhderan Kaagaddan Kanpai|| Maagaddan Mdare Jaagaddan Janpai|| Chhaadaddan Chhapran Bhaagaddan Bhaaje|| Chaagaddan Chittan Laagaddan Laaje||445||
translation: The cowards trembled and were killed in the battlefield; Many of them speedily ran away and felt shameful in their mind. 445.

gurmukhi: CwgVdMg CoirE rwgVdMg rwjw ] swgVdMg sYxM BwgVdMg Bwjw ] CwgVdMg CUty bwgVdMg bwxM ] rwgVdMg rokI dwgVdMg idswxM ]446]
transliteration: Bhaagaddaddan Bhderan Kaagaddaddan Kanpai|| Maagaddaddan Mdare Jaagaddaddan Jadpai|| Chhaadaddaddan Chhapran Bhaagaddaddan Baanan|| Raagaddaddan Rokidaagaddaddan Disaanan||446||
translation: The king was released and he ran away alongwith his army; with the discharge of arrows all the directions were covered.446.

gurmukhi: mwgVdMg mwry bwgVdMg bwxM ] twgVdMg tUty qwgVdMg qwxM ] lwgVdMg lwgy dwgVdMg dwhy ] fwgVdMg fwry bwgVdMg bwhy ]447]
transliteration: Maagaddaddan Mdare Baagaddaddan Baanan|| Taagaddaddan Toote Taagaddaddan Taanan|| Laagaddaddan Laage Daagaddaddan Daahe|| Daagaddaddan Ddare Baagaddaddan Baahe||447||
translation: By discharging the arrows, the pride of all was mashed; with the infliction of arrows all the warriors were weakened; their weapons fell down from their hands.447.

gurmukhi: bwgVdMg brKy PwgVdMg PUlM ] mwgVdMg imitE swgVdMg sUlM ] mwgVdMg mwirE BwgVdMg BUpM ] kwgVdMg kopy rwgVdMg rUpM ]448]
transliteration: Baagaddaddan Barkhe Phaagaddaddan Phoolan|| Maagaddaddan Mitio Saagaddaddan Soolan|| Maagaddaddan Maario Bhaagaddaddan Bhoopan|| Kaagaddaddan Kope Raagaddaddan Roopan||448||
translation: The flowers were showered from the sky and in this way, the trouble ended; the kalki incarnation in his fury, killed the king.448.

gurmukhi: jwgVdMg jMpY pwgVdMg pwnM ] dwgVdMg dyvM AwgVdMg AwnM ] swgVdMg isMDM kwgVdMg ik`qM ] bwgVdMg bnwey kwgVdMg kib`qM ]449]
transliteration: Jaagaddaddan Janpai Paagaddaddan Paanan|| Daagaddaddan Devan Aagaddaddan Aanan|| Saagaddaddan Sindhan Kaagaddaddan Kittan|| Baagaddaddan Banaae Kaagaddaddan Kabittan||449||
translation: The gods came from the front and catching the feet of the Lord (Kalki) eulogized him; the adepts also composed epics in Praise of the Lord.449.

gurmukhi: gwgVdMg gwvY kwgVdMg kib`qM ] DwgVdMg DwvY bwgVdMg biRqM ] hwgVdMg hohI jwgVdMg jwqRw ] nwgVdMg nwcY pwgVdMg pwqRw ]450]
transliteration: Gadgaddaddan Gadvai Kaagaddaddan Kabittan|| Dhaagaddaddan Dhaavai Baagaddaddan Britan|| Haagaddaddan Hohijaagaddaddan Jaatraa|| Naagaddaddan Naachai Paagaddaddan Paatraa||450||
translation: For eulogizing the Lord, the epics were sung and the praise of the Lord spread in all the four sides; the pious people began pilgrimages and the true devotees of the Lord began to dance.450.

gurmukhi: sMBr nryS mwirE indwn ] FolM miRdMg b`jy pRmwn ] Bwjy su bIr qj ju`D qRws ] qij SsqR srb h√çY icq inrws ]451]
transliteration: Sanbhar Daresh Maario Nidaan|| Dholan Mridan Bajje Pramaan|| Bhaaje Su Beer Taj Juddh Traas|| Taj(i) Shastra Sarab Hvai Chit Niraas||451||
translation: Ultimately, the king of Sambhal was killed; the small and large drums sounded; the warriors, frightened of war ran away and getting disappointed, they abandoned all the weapons.451.

gurmukhi: brKMq dyv puhpwx biRSt ] hovMq jgq jh qh su ieSt ] pUjMq lwg dyvI krwl ] hovMq kwrj suFwl ]452]
transliteration: Barkhannddev Puhpaan Brisht|| Hovant Jagad Jah Tah Su Isht|| Poojant Laag Devikaraal|| Hovant Siddh Kaaraj Sudhaal||452||
translation: The gods showered flowers and everywhere the patron-god was worshipped; the people adored the dreadful goddess and many works were finalized.452.

gurmukhi: pwvMq dwn jwck durMq ] BwKMq ik`q jh qh ibAMq ] jg DUp dIp j`ig Awd dwn ] hovMq hom bydn ibDwn ]453]
transliteration: Paavant Daan Jaachak Durant|| Bhaakhannddkitt Jah Rah Beant|| Jag Dhoop Deep Jagg(i) Aad Daan|| Hovant Hom Bedan Bidhaan||453||
translation: The beggars received charity and everywhere the poems were composed; the Yajnas, burning of incense, lighting of lamps, the charities etc. were all done according to vedic rites.453.

gurmukhi: pUjMq lwg dybI durMq ] qj srb kwm jh qh mhMq ] bwNDI sujwn prmM pRcMf ] pRcuirE su Drm KMfy AKMf ]454]
transliteration: Poojant Laag Debidurant|| Taj Sarab Kaam Jah Tah Mahant|| Baandhisujaan Parman Prachanndd|| Prachurio Su Dharma Khande Akhannd||454||
translation: The heads of hermitages, leaving all other works, worshipped the goddess; the powerful goddess was established again and in this way, there was propagation of the perfect Dharma.454.
